title: Spicy Sticky Rice Cakes
ingredients: ½cup thinly sliced fresh pretty spicy red chilies, like Fresnos
½cup maple syrup or agave syrup
1tablespoon Mushroom Seasoning Powder, homemade or store-bought
1pound Korean rice cake sticks, thawed if frozen, soaked in cold water for 30 minutes and drained well
1cup half-moon slices (¼ inch) yellow pickled radish
directions: PUT the scallions on a work surface and use the flat of a chef’s knife blade to firmly whack the whites to smash them. Cut the scallions into 1-inch pieces.

PUT the scallions in a large high-sided skillet along with the chilies, maple syrup, sugar, gochujang, gochugaru, mushroom seasoning powder, soy sauce, garlic, and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring frequently, and cook until the sugar has fully dissolved, about 45 seconds.

STIR in the rice cakes and inari, cover, and adjust the heat to cook at a moderate simmer, stirring occasionally, until the rice cakes are fully tender but chewy and the sauce clings to the rice cakes but is still saucy, about 4 minutes.
SERVE on plates with the pickled radish, sil-gochu, and some hot sauce.
